metadata.title: CVE-2022-34158 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A carefully crafted invocation on the Image plugin could trigger an CSRFvulnerability on Apache JSPWiki before 2.11.3, which could allow a groupprivilege escalation of the attacker's account. Further examination of thisissue established that it could also be used to modify the email associatedwith the attacked account, and then a reset password request from the loginpage.

criterions.comment: jspwiki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
